Content: we still need one more piece to really deliver "double spend attack prevention", and that is an API to query to answer the question "has this txid of COIN been notarized to KMD/BTC?"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's being worked on, James set a bounty. Without that, exchanges can't use and won't see the benefit of notarization data. And they are the ones forcing coins to implement this stuff, and making coins pay them back for double spends that happen on their exchanges(!)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We need to stop adding coins to KMD notaries ... I have almost finished a second layer system, hopefully we get to test it well enough for KMDLABS so we cna use it ... this will drive down costs for dPoW a fair bit, and stop sacrificing KMD's security. We should not have hundreds of coins, ont he main KMD notaries... its just a bad idea.

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: elevator pitch on what KMDLABS is?

Author: Audo#5667
Content: It's STAKED rebranded. @Alright knows more üòÉ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Cryptoon it's a coin to incentivize testing smart contracts. Plan to be a resource that the whole ecosystem can use to iron out bugs in smart contracts before deploying them on production chains

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: And who incentivizes? What gives LABS a value? It will be kind of pegged back to kmd then?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: You can earn LABS by finding bugs in smart contracts, staking, mining or running a notary. We set up a system to where we can add contracts on the fly without the need for a hard fork. A contract dev can spin up a chain(only cost is notarization cost), people can test this chain, if a bug is found they will make a bounty claim. If enough notaries sign off on this bounty claim, they get the coins

Author: Alright#0419
Content: So contract dev can start a chain and have people test it for basically no cost the them

Author: Alright#0419
Content: here's a elevator pitch I typed up previously

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we'll have a website up with more info next week

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
Purpose of STAKED is to give crypto condition contract devs a place to have their contracts tested. There is a problem in that a coin dev cannot just implement the first iteration of a new contract on a production coin as each bug could mean a hard fork.(think KMDICE the last couple weeks) What STAKED allows a dev to do is spin up a STAKED chain that is fungible with all other STAKED chains. They can have custom consensus rules or contracts. Testers can then be rewarded by finding bugs in these contracts. If there is a bug in the contract, they simply kill the chain, update the contract and start another chain.

STAKED will be the only asset chain with "opt-in contracts", meaning contracts are not compulsory consensus rules. In order to implement a contract on a typical assetchain, all nodes must update. On STAKED however, you simply add the contract to a new chain. If a user wants to use the contract, they sync the chain and transfer coins to it. If user isn't interested in the contract, they can simply ignore it. 
```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: replace STAKED with KMDLabs üòõ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Couple interesting projects have cropped up on it already. @blackjok3r created something called a "streamer" chain, which can be used to stream arbitrary files to a pemissioned chain that is then dpow'd to KMD. This allows for uncensorable streaming and if one copy of the chain exists, it can be proved that it is authentic. @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator is working on "DragonHound" which is a way for him to track his dog via GPS and post coordinates via oracles.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I made the trollbox proof of concept as well, but that's not LABS specific. It's on chain real time chat. Think immutable decentralized discord.
